title-group.article-title: RESIDENTIAL MORTGAGE DELINQUENCY AND FORECLOSURE IN OYO STATE PROPERTY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, NIGERIA: A DISCRIMINANT FUNCTION ANALYSIS

abstract.p: This study represents an attempt at isolating crucial variables affecting mortgage loan repayment in Oyo State Property Development Corporation, Nigeria. In particular, various classification functions are developed for different payment groups, namely, the paid up, the delinquent, and the foreclosed loans. The purpose is to formulate explicit guidelines for mortgage lending officers when evaluating prospective borrowers. Section 1 presents a background to the study. Section 2 examines the methodology and considers the variable selection and data collection aspects as well as a brief description of the technique used. Section 3 presents the results of the analyses. Section 4 provides the summary of and conclusions concerning the results of the study.
